required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Protocol for the Validation of UAud in a Clinical Setting.
clinical_study.official_title: A Study Protocol for a Double Blinded Randomised Controlled Trial to Validate the Technological Setup of UAud in a Clinical Setting.

brief_summary.textblock: The project will test if the user-operated audiometry is non-inferior to the gold standard of manual audiometry.

detailed_description.textblock:
The project will focus on the initial examination of patients who are referred for hearing aid treatment. This initial examination consists of an audiometry which is currently conducted manually by an audiologist. However, it is possible to conduct an audiometry as a user-operated self-test by using a computer. The project will test if the user-operated audiometry is non-inferior to the gold standard of manual audiometry.
The project will use several types of patient reported measures as well as objective measurements in the clinic. Research of this type is needed to understand if the quality of the hearing aid treatment is equal no matter the type of examination.

study_design_info.masking_description: Neither the participant nor care provider knows if the patient belongs to the test- or control group.

primary_outcome.measure: SSQ12 (Speech, Spatial & Qualities of Hearing scale)
primary_outcome.description: A questionnaire reflecting the patient's subjective assessment of hearing in everyday life.
A performance test of patients speech intelligibility in noise.

secondary_outcome.measure: IOI-HA (International Outcome Inventory for Hearing Aids)
secondary_outcome.description: A questionnaire regarding the patient's own perception of hearing aid outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: APHAB (Abbreviated Profile of Hearing Aid Benefit).
secondary_outcome.description: A questionnaire regarding the patient's own perception of hearing and hearing aid outcome.

arm_group.description: Patients which hearing aid is fitted based on the audiometry obtained with user-operated automated audiometry.
Patients which hearing aid is fitted based on the audiometry obtained with traditional audiometry.

intervention.description: Patients will receive hearing aid treatment based on an audiometry obtained with an user-operated automated audiometry procedure
Patients will receive hearing aid treatment based on an audiometry obtained with an traditional audiometry procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Having sensorineural hearing loss.
- Indication for hearing aid treatment (hearing thresholds exceeding 20 dB (decibel) at two or more frequencies.).
- Symmetric hearing loss with a maximum PTA (mean of 0.5-1-2-4kHz) difference between the ears of 15 dB.
- No evidence of hearing loss fluctuation over the past 12 months.
- Danish native speaker.
- Access and user of e-Boks (e-Boks is a Danish online postal system, which ensures secure communication.).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical or psychological conditions that would contraindicate audiological rehabilitation.
- Air conduction thresholds greater than 100 dB or no-responses on 3 or more high-frequencies (â‰¥ 2000 Hz).
- Central auditory nervous system disorder.
- On any medication with ototoxicity potential.
- Unwillingness or inability of the subject to comply with study requirements.

patient_data.ipd_description: Data is governed by the hospital's GPDR (General Data Protection Regulation) agreements.
